--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "warg3791" <Warg3791@a...> wrote:

 
> And finally I came across reference to something called Hijikata 
> Toshizo: Shiru no Kiseki. Is this an anime or what?! One pic is 
> definitely Hijikata in Hakodate. There's no mistaking him:
> http://www.catsuka.com/interf/forum/viewtopic.php?t=691&start=72
> 
> Unfortunately it is not in English or Japanese.

The conversation is in French. 

I went through it and apparently, while talking about Studio 4C 
latest production, someone mentionned "Hijikata Toshizo : Shiru no 
Kiseki" saying that it is a a 32 minutes long OAV. He says that it 
was made by Chie Uratani, a person who worked on : Kiki's Delivery 
Service, Memories, Princess Arete and Animatrix.

Then the person mentionned the official website 
www.hijikatatoshizou.com saying that you can find a summary and 
characters's descriptions there. Also, it is said that you can pre-
order the DVD via the website. I do not know if they took the 
different zones into consideration when saying this...

Apparently, the DVD comes with a bonus: "Sore ike Kanesada-kun !" 
(25 minutes) and 10 minutes of other bonus.

The first picture is the DVD cover, but there are no descriptions of 
the following images.

Then, the conversation shifts and "Hijikata Toshizo : Shiru no 
Kiseki" is not mentionned again.

Mary-Ann
